content.title: Stipend Scheme For Scheduled Tribes - Poultry Training Stipend
content.department: Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation
content.details: The scheme 'Stipend Scheme for Scheduled Tribes - Poultry Training Stipend' was launched to raise the income of poultry farmers of Schedule Tribes through scientific poultry farming training. Under this scheme, the beneficiary will be given a maximum ₹2000 (direct in bank account) stipend for six days of training and a poultry training certificate after completion of training.
benefits: The beneficiary will be given maximum ₹2000 (direct in bank account) stipend for six days training.
Beneficiary will be given poultry training certificate after completion of training.
eligibility: The benefits of this scheme will only be given to the adult of Schedule Tribes people of the society of Gujarat State.
The beneficiary will have to provide income proof and a caste certificate.
Females and beneficiaries Below Poverty Line will be given priority.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. The beneficiary has to apply online at I-Khedut Portal.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID Card
Disability Certificate from Competent Authority (only for PWDs) (if applicable)
Savings Account Bank Passbook or Cancelled Check (if applicable)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to raise the income of poultry farmers of Schedule Tribes through scientific poultry farming training.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits of this scheme will only be given to the adult of Schedule Tribes people of the society of Gujarat state.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will be given a maximum ₹2000 (direct in bank account) stipend for six days of training.

faqs.question: How much will daily allowance be given under this scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹300/- per day will be given as a daily allowance to the beneficiary.

faqs.question: For how many days will daily allowance be given to the trainees?
faqs.answer: Daily allowance will be given for 6 days of the training.

faqs.question: How much will transport fare be given to the trainees?
faqs.answer: ₹200/- will be given as transport fare to the beneficiary during training.

faqs.question: Who will get priority under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Females and beneficiaries below poverty line will be given priority.

faqs.question: Is an income certificate mandatory for a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the beneficiary should have an income proof certificate.

faqs.question: How will the beneficiary receive the stipend amount?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will receive the stipend amount directly in the bank account.

faqs.question: How can a beneficiary apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to visit the nearest Intensive Poultry Development Project Office or District Poultry Extension Centre and collect the application form.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary also apply online mode?
faqs.answer: Yes, an online application is to be made on I-Khedut Portal.
